body.para: OK, another posibility -- right-click he module suite ("Music NotePad"", choose Properties and go to Libraries. Now, in THAT Libraries panel (because the list below reflects modules selected on the module suite), uncheck and then check everything that is currently checked in the nodes (such as "platform6") there. Sorry for this painful process, but I'm not sure what else to do than this. Seems that those module versions need to be refreshed as well, although I don't understand why since you're using the same version of the IDE as me. (One other thing, if you haven't already, maybe try this before the unchecking.checking because it goes faster), close the IDE and delete the "private: folders in the module suite project (because that's where the problem currently is, judging from the error messages) anf then restart the IDE and open the module suite again.
Apologies for asking you to go through all this, but I can't think of anything else...

quote.quotepara: I'll be glad to report the problems I had. I am using a clean install of NetBeans 5.5 Beta 2, and I checked out jFugue this morning.
At this point, I get the following error as the application is starting up:

Warning - could not install some modules: Core - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in implementation version "1" but only "060805" was found. Favorites - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in version >= 6.2 but only 1.0 was found. Core - Windows - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in implementation version "1" but only "060805" was found. XML Model Source Retriever - The module named org.netbeans.modules.projectapi/1 was needed and not found. XML Model Source Retriever - The module named org.netbeans.modules.xml.text/2 was needed and not found. XML Model Source Retriever - The module named org.netbeans.modules.xml.xam/1 was needed and not found. Editor - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in version

Auto Update - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in version >= 6.2 but only 1.0 was found. Core - Component Palette - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in version >= 6.3 but only 1.0 was found. Musician - None of the modules providing the capability org.openide.windows.IOProvider could be installed. Datasystems API - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in version >= 6.2 but only 1.0 was found. Actions APIs - The module org-openide-explorer was requested in version >= 6.2 but only 1.0 was found. 19 further modules could not be installed due to the above problems.
Please note that I am using JDK 1.5, and I did a clean install of NetBeans this morning.

Pierre Matthijs wrote: > > -----Oorspronkelijk bericht----- > *Van:* John Reynolds [mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com>] > *Verzonden:* vrijdag 4 augustus 2006 18:43 > *Aan:* dev@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > *Onderwerp:* Re: Problem building jFugue... > > Thanks Geetjan... That got me a bit farther, but I'm beginning to > think that I should wait until the project is stable again. > > It's very unfortunate that jFugue was featured on java.net <http://java.net> > <http://java.net <http://java.net>> while in this state, but It's certainly worth the > effort to get it built. > > Sorry that I'm reacting â€¦ > > The project on java.net <http://java.net>, and thus what you downloaded, IS stable, as > much as can be, and as much as has ever been. > > The changes under development are only on my PC, and NOT on the server. > > And as a matter of fact, the reason why I asked to wait a few day's, > is just with the intension to KEEP it stable all the time. > > Pierre >
Any problems encountered should be reported and dealt with. (And then added to the FAQ that is in progress.)

> > Thanks, > > JohnR > > On 8/4/06, *Geertjan Wielenga* <Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com> > <mailto: Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com>>> wrote: > > John, > > Strange. > > In this particular case, you need to right click the Musician project > and choose Properties. Go to the Libraries panel. There you should add > the "Explorer and Property Sheet API". It should've been there already > but, like I said, we're undergoing severe structural changes at the > moment so things are a bit out of whack. > > -- Geertjan > > > > Doh! Found that setting. > > > > Now I am getting errors like: > > C:\jFugue\nbjfuguesupport\jfugueFunctionality\Musician\src\org\netbeans\modules\musician\instruments\InstrumentsTopComponent.java:11:

> > > package org.openide.explorer does not exist > > import org.openide.explorer.ExplorerManager; > > > > > > On 8/4/06, *John Reynolds* < john.t.reynolds@gmail.com <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com> > <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com>> > > <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com> > <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com <mailto:john.t.reynolds@gmail.com>>>> wrote: > > > > Thanks Geertjan, > > > > I found a netbeans library dependency, XML Tools API, that was for > > some reason specifically excluded, and that got me to the point > > where I can attempt a build. > > > > I am now getting the following: > > (try -source 1.5 to enable generics) > > Vector <Instrument>instr = new Vector<Instrument>(); > > > > > > I am using Java 1.5 (1.4 isn't installed on my workstation)... but > > I am not sure where in the project I would set -source 1.5) > > > > Thanks, > > > > JohnR > > > > > > > > > > On 8/4/06, *Geertjan Wielenga* < Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com> > <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com>> > > <mailto: Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com> > <mailto: Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com <mailto:Geertjan.Wielenga@sun.com>>>> wrote: > > > > John Reynolds wrote: > > > Please bear with me... this is probably a dumb question. > > > > > > I got the source for jFugue via CVS, opened the project in > > Netbeans > > > (5.5 beta 2), and when I try to build I get the following: > > > > > > C:\jFugue\nbjfuguesupport\nbproject\build- impl.xml:19: You must > > > define ' nbplatform.NetBeans_5.5_Beta_(Build_060717).harness.dir' > > > > > > > > > I am not sure what this means. From reading build-imple.xml , > > it seems > > > that I need to create a directory, but I am not sure > > where. Was I > > > supposed to download the Netbeans sources? > > > > > > Thanks, > > > > > > JohnR > > Hi John! > > > > Two things: > > > > 1. Pierre Matthijs is making some very large structural > > changes in the > > coming days. In terms of committing code, we shouldn't do > > anything until > > he's finished his work, which will be during the next few days. > > > > 2. But, of course, you can run the application and play with > > it. To do > > that, you need to build it. And to do THAT, what I think you > > need to do > > is go to the platform.properties file and replace the value > > you find > > there with "default". Or, delete the "private" folder and > > reopen the > > project. There's just some dependency somewhere that you need > > to refresh > > and these two steps might help. > > > > -- Geertjan > > > > --------------------------------------------------------------------- > > To unsubscribe, e-mail: > > dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net>> > > <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > <mailto: dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net>>> > > For additional commands, e-mail: > > dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > <mailto: dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net>> > > <mailto: dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net>>> > > > > > > > > --------------------------------------------------------------------- > To unsubscribe, e-mail: dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > <mailto: dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-unsubscribe@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net>> > For additional commands, e-mail: dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net> > <mailto: dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net <mailto:dev-help@nbjfuguesupport.dev.java.net>> >
